executive_summary: Golf resorts have enjoyed strong growth over the current period, but this expansion has been volatile. The outbreak of COVID-19 hammered golf resorts because of travel restrictions and social distancing measures. Still, as the economy reopened and travel restrictions were lifted, golf resorts enjoyed strong growth alongside surging domestic trips by US residents and inbound trips by non-US residents. Some economic woes led to a slowdown in growth for golf resorts late over the current period, with volatile consumer confidence impacting their performance. While revenue has expanded strongly, high wage costs have prevented considerable profit growth over the current period. Also, supply chain woes hiking purchase costs for golf resorts.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Outbreak of COVID-19 Hammered Golf Resorts
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Temporary travel restrictions in 2020 following the outbreak of COVID-19 led to considerable declines for golf resorts as domestic trips by US residents plummeted, reducing total nights spent away from home and demand for accommodations.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Golf Resorts Enjoyed a Massive Recovery as the Economy Reopened
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Following the lifting of travel restrictions, golf resorts enjoyed a massive rebound. Domestic trips by US residents surged amid pent-up demand, greatly benefitting golf resorts. Also, total inbound trips by non-US residents

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: PROFIT HAS INCHED UP, BUT SOME HEADWINDS PREVENTED STRONG GROWTH
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Despite strong revenue growth over the current period, profit has only increased modestly as wage costs have remained high. Also, supply chain woes pushing up purchase costs for golf resorts have hindered profit growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: GOLF RESORTS TO ENJOY CONSISTENT GROWTH
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Although growth will be slower than over the current period, it will be less volatile. During the outlook period, golf resorts will benefit from increased consumer spending, corporate profit and travel by both US and non-US residents.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: GOLF RESORTS TO FACE CLIMBING COMPETITION
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As increasing revenue encourages new entrants, golf resorts will face rising internal competition. Because of increased competition, golf resorts will have to adjust prices or increase resort services to differentiate themselves.

industry_definition: Golf resorts are primarily engaged in providing short-term lodging in golf club resorts and hotels. The establishments offer food and beverage services, recreational services, conference rooms, convention services and laundry services.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level high - steady

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Domestic trips by US residents
threats: Time spent on leisure and sports

key_trends: Growth has been volatile for golf resorts. Travel restrictions and social distancing measures amid the outbreak of COVID-19 led to massive declines, but pent-up demand following the reopening of the economy led to a strong recovery.
Competition will ramp up over the outlook period. The success many golf resorts have achieved will spur new entrants, hiking internal
Competition and potentially hindering profit growth
Golf resorts must abide by various regulations. Regulations relating to labor, food safety, liquor licensing and the protection of the environment impact golf resorts.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market comprises consumers visiting golf resorts for leisure and is the largest market that golf resorts serve. While total domestic trips plummeted following the outbreak of COVID-19, total domestic trips have continued to expand over the current period, promoting growth in this market. Inbound trips by non-US residents surging over the current period has also led to expansions.
This market comprises consumers visiting golf resorts for business and is the second largest market that golf resorts serve. Growth in Other Markets Has Remained Stable

Other markets comprise federal, state and local government bodies and meetings, events and incentives travelers. This market has expanded alongside overall growth for golf resorts over the current period, remaining stable as a share of revenue.

products_and_services.product_description: Accommodations comprise the various lodging options and related services provided to guests by golf resorts during their stay.
This segment comprises golf courses, facilities, golf instruction, tournaments, equipment rental and sales and other golf-related services, the primary product offerings of golf resorts.
Food and beverage services comprise the various culinary experiences, food services and dining options available at golf resorts like fine dining, room service and casual dining.
Other miscellaneous services related to golf and recreation.

tier_1_suppliers: ATV, Golf Cart & Snowmobile Manufacturing in the US
Commercial Building Construction in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Recreational Vehicle Dealers in the US
Farm, Lawn & Garden Equipment Wholesaling in the US
Sporting Goods Wholesaling in the US
Wine & Spirits Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: This market comprises consumers visiting golf resorts for leisure and is the largest market that golf resorts serve.
This market comprises consumers visiting golf resorts for business and is the second largest market that golf resorts serve.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Start-up costs of purchasing and developing land for a golf course are very high.
barriers_points.barrier_description: Start-up costs of purchasing and developing land for a golf course are very high.
Legal hurdles are not considerable, but finding skilled workers and attracting customers away from established resorts may be difficult.

basis_points.basis_description: Buyer power is high, while supplier power is moderate. Buyer's ability to compare prices and amenities golf resorts offer is their primary source of power.
The prices that various vendors offer golf resorts are their primary power source.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Most golf resorts are sole establishments
concentration_points.concentration_description: Most golf resorts are sole establishments, making accumulating a considerable market share difficult.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Golf Resorts Have Faced Climbing Purchase Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs are expected to increase to account for 18.9% of revenue in 2024. Purchase costs account for a large share of revenue and include purchasing equipment for golf, furniture for accommodations and food and beverages for dining operations.
Profit is expected to increase to account for 15.4% of revenue in 2024. Profit has only increased modestly despite strong revenue growth because wage costs have remained high over the current period.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations. A low rate does not mean that innovations cannot occur, just that the likelihood of some innovation materializing as a threat is lower. However, the concentration of technologies is high in this industry. This suggests that industry operators have exposure to potentially unforeseen areas of innovation.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated, which implies that the market has a focus on key customer segments. This presents an opportunity for strategic entrance into lower-end markets or unserved markets for innovations to take on a disruptive trajectory.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Domestic Trips Taken by US Residents Have Induced Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Trends in domestic travel and total nights spent away from home impact demand for accommodations golf resorts offer. Following the outbreak of COVID-19, domestic trips plummeted amid travel restrictions, leading to considerable declines for golf resorts. Following the lifting of travel restrictions in 2021, pent-up demand led to a surge in domestic trips taken by US residents, leading to considerable growth. This trend continued through 2022, inducing volatility.

FAQs.question: What trends impacted demand for accommodations golf resorts offer?
FAQs.answer: Trends in domestic travel and total nights spent away from home by US residents impacted demand for accommodations golf resorts offer.

FAQs.question: How did COVID-19 impact domestic trips and golf resorts initially?
FAQs.answer: Following the outbreak of COVID-19, domestic trips plummeted amid travel restrictions, leading to considerable declines for golf resorts.

FAQs.question: What happened after travel restrictions were lifted in 2021?
FAQs.answer: Following the lifting of travel restrictions in 2021, pent-up demand led to a surge in domestic trips taken by US residents, leading to considerable growth for golf resorts.

FAQs.question: What was the impact on golf resorts in 2022?
FAQs.answer: The surge in domestic trips continued through 2022, inducing volatility for golf resorts.

FAQs.question: What is the level of regulation in the industry?
FAQs.answer: The regulation in the industry is described as moderate and steady.

FAQs.question: What is the level of industry assistance?
FAQs.answer: The industry assistance is described as low and steady.
